definitions.definition: A person who was born out of wedlock , and hence often considered an illegitimate descendant.
A mongrel ( biological cross between different breeds , groups or varieties ) .
A contemptible , inconsiderate , overly or arrogantly rude or spiteful person.
examples: Some bastard stole my car while I was helping an injured person.
Don't be such a bastard already!
I assume that bastard won't be seen again.
labels: usually referring specifically to a man
definitions.label_groups: vulgar , offensive or derogatory , usually referring specifically to a man

definitions.definition: A man, a fellow, a male friend.
examples: Get over here, you old bastard !

definitions.definition: A suffering person deemed deserving of compassion .
examples: Poor bastard , I feel so sorry for him.
These poor bastards started out life probably in bad or broken homes.

definitions.definition: A child who does not know its father .
Something extremely difficult or unpleasant to deal with.
examples: Life can be a real bastard .

definitions.definition: A variation that is not genuine ; something irregular or inferior or of dubious origin, fake or counterfeit .
examples: The architecture was a kind of bastard , suggesting Gothic but not being true Gothic.

definitions.definition: A sword that is midway in length between a short-sword and a long sword; also bastard sword .
An inferior quality of soft brown sugar , obtained from syrups that have been boiled several times.
A large mould for straining sugar .
A writing paper of a particular size.
A Eurosceptic Conservative MP, especially in the government of John Major .

main_definition: ( dated ) A person who was born out of wedlock , and hence often considered an illegitimate descendant.
secondary_definitions: A mongrel ( biological cross between different breeds , groups or varieties ) .
( vulgar , offensive or derogatory , usually referring specifically to a man ) A contemptible , inconsiderate , overly or arrogantly rude or spiteful person.
( endearing or humorous ) A man, a fellow, a male friend.
( often preceded by ‘poor’ ) A suffering person deemed deserving of compassion .
( informal ) A child who does not know its father .
( informal ) Something extremely difficult or unpleasant to deal with.
A variation that is not genuine ; something irregular or inferior or of dubious origin, fake or counterfeit .
A sword that is midway in length between a short-sword and a long sword; also bastard sword .
An inferior quality of soft brown sugar , obtained from syrups that have been boiled several times.
A large mould for straining sugar .
A writing paper of a particular size.
( UK , politics , derogatory ) A Eurosceptic Conservative MP, especially in the government of John Major .
